metadata.name: SPACE STONE
metadata.description:
The Space Stone originally contained in the Tesseract 
(based on the Cosmic Cube from Marvel Comics) is an 
Infinity Stone that controls one of the aspects of 
being - the aspect of Space. The stone gives the user 
the ability to open wormholes and instantly move through 
space within the universe. The user of the Space Stone 
can manipulate space in every sense - move objects 
(telekinetic actions), change their density and size; 
use space as a shield; open black holes and so on. 
The Space Stone releases an infinite amount of energy 
while in its shell - the Tesseract.  
In 1943, the Tesseract was used by HYDRA commander Johann 
Schmidt to create a universal weapon with which he was 
going to win the war, but subsequently, the Tesseract 
was lost. Some time later, the Tesseract was found by 
Howard Stark. In 1970, it was used by Project P.E.G.A.S., 
an organization of S.H.I.E.L.D., to create ultra-fast 
space engines under the direction of Mar-Vell, a Kree 
scientist race. During a Kree attack on Mar-Vell and 
pilot Carol Danvers, the explosion of a similar engine 
grants Carol superpowers.After Carol Danvers and Nick 
Fury found the Tesseract in an orbital base created by 
Mar-Vell, the Tesseract was on Earth with the S.H.I.E.L.D. 
until 2012. After a failed invasion by Loki's army sent 
by Thanos to Earth, the Tesseract is sent to Asgard, 
where it is kept until the events of Thor: Ragnarok, 
where it was secretly stolen by Loki just before Ragnarok. 
Later, during an attack on the ship of the Asgardian 
survivors, the Tesseract was crushed by Thanos, and the 
Stone itself was placed in the Infinity Gauntlet.  
After Thanos' Snap, the Stone was destroyed by its own 
power by Thanos himself on the planet 0-259S (Titan II), 
as the latter did not see the point in its existence, 
since the Stone had already done its job. In 2023, the 
Avengers, who had discovered a way to travel through time, 
attempted to remove the alternate Space Stone from 2012 
during Operation Time Raid, but the attempt failed and 
the Stone was given to Loki.The alternate Space Stone 
was later removed from the alternate 1970 by Tony Stark 
and used further by Bruce Banner to cancel Thanos' Snap. 
The Stone, along with other alternate Stones, was used 
by Tony Stark to destroy the alternate Thanos' army from 
2014. The alternate Space Stone was eventually brought 
back to 1970 by Steve Rogers.
